tripreview.Title: "Temple without idole"
tripreview.sentence: This is the main temple in Thrissur and one of the main temple of art and culture.
The main festival is Pooram .
The amazing thing the idol is not visible, as it is covered under 4 meter high and 6 meter wide mount of ghee, formed by daily Pooja with ghee over centuries.
The nearst airport is Cochiin and railwaystation Trisivaperur(Thrissur).

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking Sight"
tripreview.sentence: The temple is quite huge and it takes a while to go for one complete round of the temple.

tripreview.Title: "Divine"
tripreview.sentence: The temple is big, its so peaceful inside.
There are a lot of place to rest and is very green inside.
Amazing feeling to be inside a temple in the heart of the city and still feel so serene and fresh.

tripreview.Title: "A Beautiful Experience!!"
tripreview.sentence: This ancient temple is located in the heart of Thrissur city.
The premises are very well maintained and clean.
It is a very serene, calm and peaceful place.
Its about 1300 years old and a must visit in Kerala.
Non Hindus are not allowed inside the temple.
The is a procedure to pray in the temple which is displayed as we enter the temple.

tripreview.Title: "pooram temple"
tripreview.sentence: thrissur town is basically around this famous temple.
pooram is the famous festival here and tens of thousands of people throng here to watch elephants and fire works.

tripreview.Title: "Peaceful lace in the heart of town"
tripreview.sentence: Vadakkumnathan temple is in the heart of Thrissur town.
It is known as Parasurama Kshetram.
Lord Parasurama is said to have established the Shiva lingam.
There is a tall villakku outside the temple, which stands on an tortoise.
At the foot of the villakku is a small brass statue of Lord Parasurama.
Definitely worth visiting for the tranquil atmosphere in the heart of a bustling city likr Thrissur.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing experience"
tripreview.sentence: once of the temples in Kerala you should not miss.
Its the centre of attraction for thrissoor pooram situated in the middle of famour thekkinkad maithan and thrissur round.

tripreview.Title: "The face of the Thrissur"
tripreview.sentence: The temple have a vast history of over 1000 years.
its a simple yet majestic temple in the heart of thrissur.
its quite easy to find.
FYI travellers, this temple is open for only hindus and non-hindus are not allowed to enter.
But if you want to visit , please consider coming on day of thrissur pooram, which is said to be one of the greatest event on earth.
the dates do varies from end of aprill to starting of May.

tripreview.Title: "Holiness in Tradition"
tripreview.sentence: With the tradition imbibed with the holiness the temple carries it's own values.
Be there on POORAM day to know the culture of worship lord Shiva.

tripreview.Title: "The heart of Thrissur"
tripreview.sentence: There are are all kinds of temples all along the Kerala stretch.
But Vadakkunnathan stands out.
Early morning or evening, the temple invites you to the quietness it surrounds.
The enclosure is huge with a very big parikrama.
There are plenty of old trees adorning every corner of the ground.
There is an ancient koothambalam, just as you enter through the gopuram.
A quick darshan of Krishna and you are enveloped in silence.
Walk a little further, you reach the main deity, Shiva.
The silence here is unusual.
Shiva is seen with the chandrakala and a little snow mountain, behind.
Actually, the mountain is made up of the ghee offerings of all the devotees who visit the temple.
The smell of camphor and ghee and oil lamps overpower you.
There is a particular order in which you are to go around all the other deities - parvathy, back to Shiva, Ganesha, Shankaranarayana, Rama,
and return the same way back to Shiva.
Don't forget the Nandi.
It is huge.
After receiving the prasadam, when you come out, you are back with the trees and and quietness.
There places to prostrate which signify kashi etc.
Once you reach the next gopuram, you have a choice - either complete the parikrama or pradakshinam, or, visit the Paramekkavu Devi temple outside, return and finish the vadakkunnathan.
Then there is Parashurama and Shastha, more trees and a a lot of time to meditate!
be ready for a long walk and a lot of time to be spent here.

tripreview.Title: "Vadakunnathan temple"
tripreview.sentence: Its in the heart of Thrissur city.
Very old temple in the center of huge ground.
One should visit this place during the Pooram festival.
It will be unforgettable experience if you see the Elephant parade,Kudamattam and the fireworks.

tripreview.Title: "One of the best tourism place in Thrissur"
tripreview.sentence: Vadakkunnathan Temple, also known as Thenkailasam and Vrishabhachalam, is one of the largest and ancient Shiva temples in Kerala and India.
The temple is located in the heart of Thrissur city, is a classic example of the Kerala style of architecture.
Vadakunnathan temple is surrounded by a massive stone wall enclosing an area of nearly 9 acres (36,000 m2).
Inside this fortification, there are four gopurams each facing north, The temple theatre, known as koothambalam, has no parallel to cite anywhere else in the world.
The four magnificent gateways called gopurams and the lofty masonry wall around the temple quadrangle are also imposing pieces of craftsmanship and skill.
Deities of the sacred shrines are Lord Paramashiva, Parvathy, Sankaranarayana, Ganapathy, Sri Rama and Sri Krishna.
The Vadakkumnathan temple is renowned for its paintings and carvings.
The central shrines and Koothambalam shows perfect example of design and sculpture in wood.
Myth shows that Parasurama constructed this temple.
The vast area in and around the temple is the location of 'Thrissur Pooram', the superb temple spectacle in Kerala.
in Medam April - May which attracts lakhs of people.
But the pooram is celebrated by mainly other two temples and the diety, the Vadakkunnathan is not taking part in the festival or in the Procession.
The main attraction of the pooram is the Elanjitharamelam, and Kudamattom.

tripreview.Title: "Semma Temple @ City Center"
tripreview.sentence: We visited the Great Temple this month were lots of Elephants will be decorated and famous for Festival, the temple is well maintained and has clear Map, how to reach every nook and corner and its importance.
I have seen it is the relaxing place for many oldies and walking around the whole temple is like 1.6 km walk in the park.
Good Experience.

tripreview.Title: "beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: Amazing place with splendid architecture, right in the heart of the city.
Its huge with trees all around, and a visit is sure to calm your senses.
i have seen students come with their books to study under the great banyan trees in the early hours.

tripreview.Title: "An experience that will calm your mind"
tripreview.sentence: Undoubtedly one of the most iconic Shiva temples in the country.
Architecture that will leave you perplexed.
It is a must visit for people who are visiting Thrissur.
The temple complex is huge and therefore be prepared to walk.
Customs and Rituals are stictly followed here.
Cannot wear a shirt when entering the main temple.
Pants are allowed.
Children less than 1 year are not allowed.
Upon entering the temple you will see instructions on how to pray inside and outside the main temple.
Can be confusing, but if you want to enjoy the experience, it is ideal to follow the instructions step by step.

tripreview.Title: "Prayer at Temple"
tripreview.sentence: It is an ancient Lord Shiva Temple.
I liked to worship Lord Shiva.
There should have been line system, this made me little bit upset, but its ok.

tripreview.Title: "A must place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Visited the Vadakkunathan Temple once again.
Temple closes sharp at 11.00 and could not have darshan so visited the next day.
The Temple complex is large, serene and very peaceful although around it mad rush of traffic goes on.
The deities and the architectural beauty of the temple is worth relishing.
Definitely worth a visit for all.

tripreview.Title: "Classic ancient Siva temple"
tripreview.sentence: Over 2000 years old, this temple is one of the great Siva temples of India.
The linga is unique, like Badrinath is made of ice, this one is made of layers of ghee.
The layout of the temple is impressive and is well maintained and clean.
The atmosphere is of piety and calm.
The temple looks even more impressive in the evening if its lit up by one of the devotees' offerings.
This is one of the must-see temples in South India.

tripreview.Title: "One of the Gretest Siva Temple of Kerala"
tripreview.sentence: Recently visited Vadakkunathan Temple.
The temple mainly consists of Vadakkunathan, Parvathy, Sankara Narayanan (both siva and Vishnu) and Rama.
Very rare to see Siva, Vishnu and Rama in one prakaram.
The main Garbhagriham is in circular shape wherein main deities Vadakunathan and Parvathy placed either of the side.
The best part is you cannot see siva in the form of linga, only you will see mountain of Ghee which neither melt or spoil.
This ghee has got a curative powers.
This temple is built by Saint Parasurama and very important thing is Sri Adi Shankara Samadhi also can be seen.
Lot of great saints, persons visited and did the puja and prayers.
On the Ghee mountain, the priest used to place half moon in Gold (i.e. crescents in 13 nos.
The famous Thrissur Pooram will be celebrated in this temple ground.
The magnificent part of the Pooram is Kudamattam (Change of Umbrellas).
This temple is landmark of Thrissur.
Must to see this gigantic temple of Thrissur.
When you see the temple a particular place where you can prey towards Ramanatha Swamy of Rameswaram and Natarajar of Chidambaram.
By standing in this temple, you can have imaginary darshan of famous temples of south India.

tripreview.Title: "serene"
tripreview.sentence: here is the vadakkunnathan temple this temple is very popular in thrisuur area this is the place were u can be very calm and peace and find the stress out.

tripreview.Title: "one of the finest temple in keral"
tripreview.sentence: early morn 3 the temple has so many devotees thronging .
we get the ghee as prasad which was covering the vadakunathan.
absolute devotion and no unneccessary talk while you are inside.
when ever i get a chance i will definitely go to this temple.

tripreview.Title: "Biggest Temple"
tripreview.sentence: It is an ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva.
This is the first temple built by Parasurama, the sixth incarnation of Vishnu.
One of the most colourful temple festivals of Kerala, Thrissur Pooram is conducted in the temple premises.

tripreview.Title: "Really holy! Amazingly clean!!!"
tripreview.sentence: We attended the last 2 days of the Puram festival, followed by a final darshan the day after.
What strikes you most about the temple is the simplicity in design and the allround cleanliness, inspite of such huge crowds.
Darshan happens early morning to 11.00 am.

tripreview.Title: "Great Temple"
tripreview.sentence: Good old temple.
It is in the centre of thrissur town.
This temple have lot of stories to tell.
The famous Kudamattam and Elanjithara Melam and the Firework are some of the events associated with this temple.

tripreview.Title: "A very special place!!"
tripreview.sentence: Was here once again, for the Pooram 28th - 30th April 2015.
As always, very well maintained and serene.
Enjoyed the entire event which was choreographed to a perfect time schedule.
The presence of a huge crowd at the events is an uncomfortable aspects especially for ladies and children.
Well behaved crowd though.
As in many Kerala temples, to go into the sanctum sanctorum the males have to be in a dhoti / mundu with bare chest.
Women are allowed in churidar kurtas and need not necessarily be in a saree.

tripreview.Title: "Pooram"
tripreview.sentence: Very nice visuals Trissur pooram.
Centre of trissur city, 3days enjoyment.
Next day morning of trissur pooram cracker work amazing.

tripreview.Title: "The Great Temple"
tripreview.sentence: This is the Great Temple where the famous Trissur Pooram talking place.
This temple have lot of stories to tell.
The famous Kudamattam and Elanjithara Melam and the Firework are some of the events .

tripreview.Title: "The heart and soul of Thrissur"
tripreview.sentence: Located in the centre of Thrissur city in Swaraj Round, this most famous Shiva temple named Vadakkunnathan or Lord of North.
This Shiva temple temple has a long lineage of history attached with it.
The rules and procedures of offering prayers are entirely different fron normal temples in India, and it is displayed on a large area how to offer prayers and which order it should be done.
Also it is bekieved taht until one's designated time has arrived, one cannot have a chance to visit this temple.

tripreview.Title: "Religious trip"
tripreview.sentence: Earlier two or three times we had visted.
In 2013 May we visited and it was open upto 11.00 am.

So this time in March 2015 this year we visited around 10.10 am and the temple authorities said the temple doors were closed at 9.00 am because of construction work going on there, which is very very disappointing to the devotees coming from a long distance.
Hence in our opinion, please ask the local people if you know anybody as to whether the temple is open and upto what time etc.
Then only you should venture accordingly giving preference to the temple that is likely to close earlier.

tripreview.Title: "Truly Wonderful, a symbol of Kerela Architecture!"
tripreview.sentence: It is a very big temple with a vast ground around it.
The temple is built in typical Kerela architecture which is really worth enjoying if you are an architecture lover.
There is a good green cover around the temple which makes the place lovely.
On the spiritual side, I felt absolute divinity and peace while inside the temple.
It is very clean and well maintained temple.
The temple opens from 5am to 10.30 am in the morning and 5pm to 7 or 7.30pm in the evening.
Its a must visit place if you land in Thrissur.

tripreview.Title: "Serene divinity"
tripreview.sentence: For the devout this is a squeaky clean divine place.
Spread over oodles of serene land dotted with smaller shrines,Vadakkunnathan or the Lord of Kailas is an ancient temple.
This is also the venue of the famed Thrissur pooram festival.
The main sanctum has a shivalinga adorned with a garland of crescents and a mound of ghee.
Visit just after dusk so that you can take in the new subtle lighting around the campus.

tripreview.Title: "Peaceful"
tripreview.sentence: We were lucky to have found a noble gentleman who explained the steps / pre-defined route to offer the prayers at the temple
was fascinating to know
that people follow a protocol as well they had the time to explain

tripreview.Title: "Open spaces and large temple offering you peace of mind"
tripreview.sentence: The place is quite secluded on a normal day and there's a lot to walk around amid tall trees.
I feel fresh and rejuvenated each time I visit this place for the silence and peaceful ambience it beholds.

tripreview.Title: "Heavenly feel"
tripreview.sentence: Situated at the heart of Thrissur.
Closely related to thrissur pooram.
One of my favorite places in Thrissur.

tripreview.Title: "Biggest festival in Kerala is here !!"
tripreview.sentence: This is one of the famous temples in south India.
Kerala's biggest festival Thrissur Pooram takes places here every year and one shouldn't miss this and it occurs every May.
Please make sure you have Earmuffs when you stay there as they fire Huge amount of Crackers with loud noise.

tripreview.Title: "Vadakkunnathan Temple"
tripreview.sentence: If you appreciate temple architecture and like to hang around sometime in a peaceful surroundings and if you happen to visit Kerala do not miss Vadakkunnathan (Lord Siva)Temple in Trichur, which is the cultural capital of Kerala.
The town is planned around the ground called Tekkinkaadu maidanam and the temple is situated in the centre of the huge ground.
The age old huge banyan tree in front of the temple welcome you to the temple.
Evening is the best time to visit as the lights bring a divine atmosphere.
Dress code to be followed.
Men have to remove their shirts
jeans and other such clothes are not allowed.

tripreview.Title: "Time to Pray and Calm your mind."
tripreview.sentence: This temple is the place where one can find absolute peace of mind.
The place in which the temple is situated is very vast and there is lot of walking space surrounding the temple.
The evening time many people sit in the grassland ground around the temple.

tripreview.Title: "Temple review"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful old temple.
Has many smaller temples inside and outside to be seen.
Most of the temples here require the men to remove their shirts and the women must be clad in a sari.

tripreview.Title: "Nice Preserved Garden and temples"
tripreview.sentence: This temple is right in the center of the town.
The entire area is like a protected sacred sanctuary.
As soon as you enter from the huge stone built main door (there are 4, in 4 directions) you land into this pristine garden.
One can see all big trees mentioned in Indian mythological literature.
The main temple complex is also built in black basalt.
The temple outer walls are painted with murals.
The Shrines of Shiva and Rama are must visit.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful and Peaceful"
tripreview.sentence: We went to the temple which is located in the Thrissur round on our way to guruvayoor.
First of all, this is a huge temple with a bigger compound.
They place is really well maintained with a lot of trees and gives you a sense of tranquility.
The main deity is Shiva and it does have places from which you can pray to other important Shiva temples like rameshwaram.
Overall you feel really nice after your visit to this temple.
Do note that the temple compound area is vast and if you enjoy walking this is the place to come to.

tripreview.Title: "Peaceful temple surrounded by an aura."
tripreview.sentence: Very old temple still following traditions.
Spend some time in temple premises to get a soothing feel.
If you visit in the morning, a walk inside the temple would certainly jack up your oxygen input.

tripreview.Title: "The Lord who gives when you pray"
tripreview.sentence: The Lord Shiva called as Vadakkunnathar gifted Sivaguru and Aryamba couple The Adhi Sankaracharya when the childless couple prayed HIM for a child.
Our prayers also will be fulfilled if you sincerely pray the kind and powerful Lord Shiva here.

Beautiful, serene, calm and peaceful, the Ghee on top of Shivalinga is frozen for years and there is no fly or ants, ghee doesn't melt and is also to the tune of about 2 to 3 tonnes( As I heard from temple priests ), means no abhishekam or dressing for the lord which is unique.
You have to remove your shirt or banian to have darshan inside temple as it is the tradition in Kerala temples.

There are corners notified in the parikrama ( pradakshanam) path when you come around pointing out directions showing Chidambaram, Rameswaram and few other powerful and important Shiva temples in South India.
Simply claim, turn to the direction indicated and pray, you get all punyas for having visited that Shiva temple pointed.
Lord Shiva called vadakkunnathar ensures we get additional benefits and blessings.
I always go early morning and walk inside the temple for about half an hour, a good exercise cum parikrama for Lord in a beautiful and healthy atmosphere.
If you cannot walk in barefoot inside then walk outside temple inside swaraj square with your jog shoes.
This is the only cleanest place without traffic at Thrissur.

tripreview.Title: "culture must"
tripreview.sentence: you don't get into the temple but it a culture must just to be there to watch everyone doing their daily visit
but there is also the horse palace (horses engraved in roof) next to the temple and this is worth a visit too

tripreview.Title: "Magnificient temple."
tripreview.sentence: Traditional hindu temple.
It is famous more as richest temple of India.
Ladies are required to wear saree or kind of shawl below waist and gents are required to remove shirt and wear lungi like cloth below waist.

tripreview.Title: "some time with history"
tripreview.sentence: very ancient temple of God Vishnu.
massive campus and gives a spiritual feeling all through.

tripreview.Title: "if you are religious visit"
tripreview.sentence: this temple is the richest one but poor god and devotees but the maharaja and trustees must be busy counting the wealth.
only thing they have left to make money is to allow selfie with god and charge they have commercialized this place.

tripreview.Title: "Reclining pose of Lord Vishnu."
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful temple architecture.
a Temple didicated to Lord Vishnu.
it has the idol of the Lord in a reclining pose ,with a shesh Naag over his head like aqn umbrella and Lord Brahma, in a lotus with a string from Lord Vishnu navel.
The idol cannot be viewed in ite entirety but has to be seen in three parts ,viz;the head ,the middle ,and the feet .
the men have to be in an attire of Dhoti and no upper cloth and the ladies have to wear a sari or long skirt , so has the legs are not exposed.
the attire is compulsory, or entry to the temple is forbidden.
You can avail of the dhoti at the gate of the temple
lockers are provided to keep the clothes .
The brahmin will guide you thro the temple ,and Dakshana is expected ,[[tip} The best time to visit is in winter, because summer is uncomfortable walking bare foot towards the temple.

tripreview.Title: "God in God's Own Country"
tripreview.sentence: This temple is believed to be over a 1000 years old.
The temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu is unique in many ways.
Here the idol of Vishnu is in a lying position and the idol is 18 feet long.
Its a very orthodox place where only hindus are allowed and all men should remove their shirt and must wear the traditional "mundu".
The security in and around the temple was beefed up recently due to the fact that the temple holds treasures worth billions of rupees.

tripreview.Title: "Very Impressive Temple - Just A Shame That Not Everyone Is Allowed Inside"
tripreview.sentence: It's an impressive temple but you can only get close (never mind enter) if you are the correct religion.
It is however well worth seeing and taking time to watch people as they go to and fro.
If you aren't a Hindu don't get too close to the steps otherwise the guards will let you know, in no uncertain terms, that you can't get any closer.
You can however combine your view of the temple with a trip to the Puthen Malika Palace Museum next door.
Top Tip: Take a telephoto lens and/or binoculars for a closer look at the architecture.

tripreview.Title: "Rajan Manchanda "
tripreview.sentence: An experience of a life time.
Had a Great Darshan.
A very Grand Temple with a very Rich Heritage.
A visit to Kerela just cannot be fulfilling with out visiting this Temple.

tripreview.Title: "Nice Temple"
tripreview.sentence: Worth a visit if you visiting Kovallam or Trivandrum.
Specific dress code of Saree and Lungi only.
So be prepared in advance.

tripreview.Title: "Great building"
tripreview.sentence: Temple area and main building are great.

tripreview.Title: "A must visit "
tripreview.sentence: The temple is a must visit if you are in Trivandrum.
Its architecture is great .
Be on time to avoid long queue.
A dress code is there so you must follow that.

tripreview.Title: "very sacred place"
tripreview.sentence: World's richest temple located over 7.5 acres of land .
one must visit this temple and feel enlightened and satisfied .
Lord vishnu idle is 18 feet long in laid down position loaded with gold, diamonds, pearls, silver etc .

tripreview.Title: "must visit temple"
tripreview.sentence: Grand Krishna temple, has huge queues so get in line a good hour earlier.
There is a provision of special aarti which I dont think added more value except of shortening the queue.
there is strict dress code for this temple.
Men and women need to wear dhotis for darshan.
For women, saari or lehengas are also allowed.

tripreview.Title: "Very good temple only thing I hate is I need to remove the shirt"
tripreview.sentence: Very good one but there is no proper cloak room and in between temple if we go without slipper means it was very hot .

tripreview.Title: "LAND OF SRI PADMANABHA"
tripreview.sentence: One of the ancient temples dedicated to Lord Vishnu who is lying in the serpentine bed managed by the Royal family of Travancore for time immemorial.
Due to discovery of abundant wealth in the treasury of the temple, as per the direction of the Supreme Court of India, an Administrative Committee has been formed.
Strict time norms and dress codes are followed in the temple.

tripreview.Title: "world richest temple"
tripreview.sentence: I have visited this place in the month of January with my family.
It is very big temple under high security.
You have to wear dhoti to visit to this place.
Statue of lord is very beautiful.
It is very old and beautiful temple.

tripreview.Title: ""Sree Padmanabha Swamy..the temple of history""
tripreview.sentence: very wonderful, holly place to visit in Kerala
which is located very near to trivandrum central railway station
males should wear dothi only no shirt or pants allowed
even female should come in saree
if u were wearing chudidar u should wrap dothi and enter
special dharshan tickets are available 180/- and 200/- (both are for 2 people entrance and prasad will be complimentarywhich is of 60/- cost if u want seperately, for 200 archana will be done)
my suggestion is to go for special dharsan

tripreview.Title: "Very peaceful"
tripreview.sentence: It was a good experience, you can not miss this when you are in thiruvananthpuram.
in the evening 5 to 6:15 are most suitable timinngs for darshan.

tripreview.Title: "Temple of mythological importance"
tripreview.sentence: Its a very old temple worshipping Lord Vishnu.
Its known for it architectural importance and immense wealth stored beneath.
Temple is under high security and is mostly crowded,hence plan your visit carefully during peak timings.
They have a website which clearly lays down the temple timings,but keep in mind that it would get rescheduled depending on day's pujas.
So if you are a traveller you may call the temple authorities for updates.
Dresscode is strict but I have heard that you can rent out dhotis from shops nearby or buy them too.
The 'Palpayasam' "prasad" is also know for its taste.
Atmosphere jn the premises are very calm but inside the main dome its all hurry berry.

tripreview.Title: "Serenity and trust amalgamated"
tripreview.sentence: I visited the place around 4:30 am and it was less crowded but very peaceful.
I attended mangalarati there and it was like an out of the world feeling.
this is a must visit place in Kerala.

tripreview.Title: "Good temple in the mid of city"
tripreview.sentence: Visit atleast once if you are going towards TRV.
The temple is really good.
The story behind the temple needs to be known for its importance.

tripreview.Title: "Must vist Devine Temple"
tripreview.sentence: Any person who visits this temple can experiance gods presence in this temple.
Very well managed clean temples I have ever been in recent times.
Temple opens very early in morning with lots of breaks in between for Darshan due to rituals during day.
Please check for timings and visit the temple in traditional attire only as they are very particular of dress code.

tripreview.Title: "Recently I have visited Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple"
tripreview.sentence: Its a very old temple and worth visiting if you are visiting places in south kerala.
Male visitors are not permitted with any type of trousers , they should wear only the traditonal mundu and nothing on top .
female visitor is permitted to wear only saree .
churidars or any type of other dress is not permitted.
However the tradional mundu is sold at the temple for Rs 40 to 65 .
Ladies hand bags are permitted.
Mobiles .
cameras and any other bags are not permitted and can be kept in the cloak room which is close to temple.
The voulanteers at anna pasadam are not polite.
The darshan timings are displayed out side the temple .

tripreview.Title: "Amazing Architecture, great spiritual place"
tripreview.sentence: You need to be respectful of Hindu religion to enter this temple.
There is strict dress code.
if you are not from India, most likely you will not have the required dhoti.
They do sell you one for about a $1.
This is brand new and yours to keep.
This is an awe inspiring temple, built centuries ago.
The local kings made huge donations in gold - generation after generation.
Hence its one of the richest temples (richer than many countries

tripreview.Title: "great architecture"
tripreview.sentence: the temple is only open for hindus.
non hindus are allowed to see temple from outside.
great architecture.
